C. AWS Security Token Service (AWS STS)

AWS STS is the service that provides temporary security credentials. It enables you to request temporary, limited-privilege credentials for AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users. These credentials are ideal for users who are not typically in your AWS environment, but who need temporary access.

Incorrect options:

A. IAM policies: IAM policies define permissions for an action regardless of the method that you use to perform the operation. They don't grant temporary security credentials.

B. IAM user groups: IAM user groups are a way of organizing IAM users to assign permissions to many users at one time. However, they also do not provide temporary credentials.

D. AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On): AWS Single Sign-On is a cloud SSO service that makes it easy to centrally manage SSO access to multiple AWS accounts and business applications. While it does provide a way for users to access AWS services, it doesn't provide temporary security credentials.

The architectural design principle of the AWS Well-Architected Framework is A. Loosely couple components.

Loose coupling is a design principle that promotes the creation of independent components within a system. This means that components can be developed, deployed, and scaled independently, without impacting other components in the system. By loosely coupling components, systems can be more resilient, easier to maintain, and more adaptable to change.

A. loosely coupling components, is a key architectural design principle of the AWS Well-Architected Framework. It involves designing systems so that the components are decoupled and can operate independently of each other. This allows for greater flexibility, scalability, and resilience, and reduces the risk of cascading failures.

Option B, building monolithic systems, is not an architectural design principle of the AWS Well-Architected Framework. Monolithic systems can be difficult to scale and maintain, and are more prone to failures.

The Amazon S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class offers C. Automatic cost savings by moving objects between tiers based on access pattern changes.

Amazon S3 Intelligent-Tiering is a storage class that automatically moves objects between two access tiers based on changing access patterns. It is designed to optimize costs for data with unknown or changing access patterns. The two access tiers available are the frequent access tier and the infrequent access tier, and objects that have not been accessed for a period of time can be automatically moved to the lower-cost tier.
